articles.headline: Gas-and-Brake Pedal Gets New Look After Recalls
articles.snippet: A Japanese inventor designed a brake-accelerator pedal, which has come under a spotlight since allegations that some Toyotas speed up without warning.
articles.abstract: A Japanese inventor designed a brake-accelerator pedal, which has come under a spotlight since allegations that some Toyotas speed up without warning.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMANA, Japan  Two pedals, inches apart, one for gas and the other for brakes. For years, a Japanese inventor has argued that this most basic of car designs is dangerously flawed.

articles.headline: BlackBerry Maker Resists Governments’ Pressure
articles.snippet: As a top executive of Research In Motion reassured users about its network’s integrity, Saudi Arabia ordered local cellphone providers to halt BlackBerry service.
articles.abstract: As a top executive of Research In Motion reassured users about its network’s integrity, Saudi Arabia ordered local cellphone providers to halt BlackBerry service.
articles.lead_paragraph: A top executive of Research In Motion, the Canadian company that makes BlackBerry smartphones, said on Tuesday that his company would not give in to pressure from foreign governments to provide access to its customers’ messages.

articles.headline: A Labor Market Punishing to Mothers
articles.snippet: Our economy exacts a terribly steep price for any time away from work, in both pay and promotions.
articles.abstract: Our economy exacts a terribly steep price for any time away from work, in both pay and promotions.

articles.headline: After Haiti Quake, the Chaos of U.S. Adoptions
articles.snippet: Washington responded to the disaster in Haiti by lifting visa requirements, and some safeguards were ignored.
articles.abstract: Washington responded to the disaster in Haiti by lifting visa requirements, and some safeguards were ignored.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAXTER, Minn. — Beechestore and Rosecarline, two Haitian teenagers in the throes of puberty, were not supposed to be adopted.

articles.headline: More Workers Face Pay Cuts, Not Furloughs
articles.snippet: Local and state governments, as well as some companies, are resorting to wage reductions, often to avoid layoffs.
articles.abstract: Local and state governments, as well as some companies, are resorting to wage reductions, often to avoid layoffs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The furloughs that popped up during the recession are being replaced by a highly unusual tactic: actual cuts in pay.

articles.headline: Consumers Saving More Than Thought
articles.snippet: After a government report of increased consumer saving, the questions now are whether the frugality will continue and whether reluctance to spend will hinder economic growth.
articles.abstract: After a government report of increased consumer saving, the questions now are whether the frugality will continue and whether reluctance to spend will hinder economic growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: American consumers have been salting away more of their paychecks than initially reported.

articles.headline: A Coffee Conundrum
articles.snippet: Green Mountain Coffee Roasters promotes its environmental record, but most of its sales last year came from nonrecyclable single-use pods.
articles.abstract: Green Mountain Coffee Roasters promotes its environmental record, but most of its sales last year came from nonrecyclable single-use pods.
articles.lead_paragraph: WATERBURY, Vt.  Green Mountain Coffee Roasters has built a reputation as an eco-friendly company since it was founded nearly 30 years ago.

articles.headline: Biggest U.S. Book Chain Up for Sale
articles.snippet: Barnes & Noble’s announcement surprised analysts and alarmed publishers, who have watched as the book business has increasingly shifted to online retailers and e-book sales.
articles.abstract: Barnes & Noble’s announcement surprised analysts and alarmed publishers, who have watched as the book business has increasingly shifted to online retailers and e-book sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: In what might be the latest sign of trouble for brick-and-mortar bookstores, the mega-chain Barnes & Noble announced on Tuesday that its board was putting the company up for sale.

articles.headline: Intel Settles With F.T.C. On Antitrust
articles.snippet: The chip maker Intel agreed to change some practices under a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission.
articles.abstract: The chip maker Intel agreed to change some practices under a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Intel agreed to refrain from a host of business practices to settle accusations of anticompetitive behavior in the market for computer processing and graphics chips, under a settlement announced on Wednesday with the Federal Trade Commission.
articles.byline: By Edward Wyatt and Ashlee Vance
